channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Google Is Fined $3.5 Billion for Breaking Europe’s Antitrust Laws
item.description: European Union officials accused the American tech giant of using its size and dominance to undercut rivals in the online advertising market.

item.title: Greetings from Guhagar, India, where newly hatched turtles get some help into the sea
item.description: Far-Flung Postcards is a weekly series in which NPR's international team shares moments from their lives and work around the world.

item.title: Israel is blasting through Gaza City neighborhoods, but people have nowhere to go

item.title: Talks Between Adams and Trump Adviser Center on Saudi Ambassadorship

item.title: The U.S. added only 22,000 jobs last month, showing cracks in the labor market

item.title: How a Top Secret SEAL Team 6 Mission Into North Korea Fell Apart
item.description: The 2019 operation, greenlit by President Trump, sought a strategic edge. It left unarmed North Koreans dead.

item.title: American Who Posed as Irish Heiress Is Found Guilty of Theft and Fraud
item.description: Marianne Smyth was convicted in Northern Ireland, and could face up to 10 years in prison.
